stimulusHtml: The continuous function f is positive and has domain x > 0. If the asymptotes of the graph of f are x = 0 and y = 2, which of the following statements must be true?
choicesHtml: lim x→ 0 + f( x )=∞ MathType@MTEF@5@5@@444A@  and  lim x→2 f( x )=∞ MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4312@

lim x→ 0 + f( x )=2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4395@  and  lim x→∞ f( x )=0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4310@

lim x→ 0 + f( x )=∞ MathType@MTEF@5@5@@444A@  and  lim x → ∞ f ( x ) = 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4310@

lim x→2 f( x )=∞ MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4312@  and  lim x → ∞ f ( x ) = 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4310@
